title: Authors and Citation
text: Parry J (2025). arcgisutils: ArcGIS Utility Functions. R package version 0.3.3.9000, https://github.com/R-ArcGIS/arcgisutils.
code: @Manual{,   title = {arcgisutils: ArcGIS Utility Functions},   author = {Josiah Parry},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.3.3.9000},   url = {https://github.com/R-ArcGIS/arcgisutils}, }

title: ArcGIS Utility Functions
text: arcgisutils foundational infrastructure package powers R-ArcGIS Bridge Data Location Service ecosystem. provides sophisticated, production-ready tools interacting ArcGIS Online, ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Platform via REST APIs.

title: ArcGIS Utility Functions
text: 🔐 Comprehensive Authentication: Multiple OAuth2 workflows (auth_code(), auth_client()) API key legacy token support Automatic token refresh validation Integration ArcGIS Pro via arcgisbinding 🌐 Portal Integration: Advanced content search filtering, sorting, pagination User, group, organization metadata management Portal item discovery content management workflows ⚙️ Geoprocessing Services: Support geoprocessing service framework built upon R6 S7 Enables users call custom geoprocessing services build top existing services R6-based job management (arc_gp_job) real-time status tracking built-result parsing 📄 Esri JSON Ecosystem: Bidirectional conversion R spatial data Esri JSON formats Support FeatureSets, geometry objects, field definitions, spatial reference systems Optimized parsing automatic sf integration 🛠️ Developer Utilities: Standardized HTTP client (arc_base_req(), arc_paginate_req()) Robust error detection user-friendly error messages URL parsing, service introspection, metadata extraction

title: ArcGIS Utility Functions
text: arcgisutils part arcgis metapackage, provides complete R-ArcGIS Bridge toolkit. users, installing metapackage recommended: can also install arcgisutils individually CRAN: install development version:
code: install.packages("arcgis") install.packages("arcgisutils") pak::pak("r-arcgis/arcgisutils")

title: ArcGIS Utility Functions
text: Authorization tokens provided functions auth_code(), auth_client(), auth_user(), auth_key(), auth_binding(). Additional token validation functions provided via refresh_token() validate_or_refresh_token(). auth_code() can used integrating Shiny applications, example, individual users log . recommend using auth_key() authenticating non-interactive environments (example scheduled scripts deployments). Tokens managed using set_arc_token() unset_arc_token(). fetched using arc_token(). set_arc_token() can set token globally set multiple named environments. minimal example: Alternatively, tokens can set based key-value pair multiple environments: fetched based name via
code: library(arcgisutils) #>  #> Attaching package: 'arcgisutils' #> The following object is masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     %||% key <- auth_key() set_arc_token(key) set_arc_token("production" = prod_token, "development" = dev_token) arc_token("production")

title: ArcGIS Utility Functions
text: Search discover content across ArcGIS organization:

title: ArcGIS Utility Functions
text: Always use arc_base_req() handle setting user agent authorization token. function creates standardized httr2 request object: handle paginated services requests use arc_paginate_req() automatically handle fetching pages.
code: # defaults to arcgis.com host <- arc_host()   req <- arc_base_req(host) req #> <httr2_request> #> GET https://www.arcgis.com #> Body: empty #> Options: #> * useragent: "arcgisutils v0.3.3.9000"

title: ArcGIS Utility Functions
text: also number utility functions creating parsing Esri JSON. example can create Esri FeatureSet json string using as_esri_featureset() directly sf object. Feature set json can also parsed using parse_esri_json(). Additionally, sf’s crs object can converted spatialReference JSON object using validate_crs(). Convert json yyjsonr jsonify.
code: library(sf)  # load the NC SIDS dataset and extract centroids # of the first few rows nc <- system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf") |>    st_read(quiet = TRUE) |>    st_centroid()   # convert to json nc_json <- as_esri_featureset(nc[1:2, 1:3])  jsonify::pretty_json(nc_json) #> { #>     "geometryType": "esriGeometryPoint", #>     "spatialReference": { #>         "wkid": 4267 #>     }, #>     "features": [ #>         { #>             "geometry": { #>                 "x": -81.4982290095261, #>                 "y": 36.43139560823758 #>             }, #>             "attributes": { #>                 "AREA": 0.114, #>                 "CNTY_": 1825.0, #>                 "PERIMETER": 1.442 #>             } #>         }, #>         { #>             "geometry": { #>                 "x": -81.12512977849917, #>                 "y": 36.49110847237506 #>             }, #>             "attributes": { #>                 "AREA": 0.061, #>                 "CNTY_": 1827.0, #>                 "PERIMETER": 1.231 #>             } #>         } #>     ] #> } parse_esri_json(nc_json) #> Simple feature collection with 2 features and 3 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -81.49823 ymin: 36.4314 xmax: -81.12513 ymax: 36.49111 #> Geodetic CRS:  NAD27 #>    AREA CNTY_ PERIMETER                   geometry #> 1 0.114  1825     1.442  POINT (-81.49823 36.4314) #> 2 0.061  1827     1.231 POINT (-81.12513 36.49111) crs <- validate_crs(27700) jsonify::pretty_json(crs, unbox = TRUE) #> { #>     "spatialReference": { #>         "wkid": 27700 #>     } #> }

title: ArcGIS Utility Functions
text: geoprocessing service framework completely supported arcgisutils. combine functionality geoprocessing job framework utilities as_esri_featureset() call Trace DownStream Elevation Service new function can called start new job: Jobs run asynchronously can check status job$status , job complete, can fetch results applying result function parse_gp_feature_record_set() case.
code: trace_downstream <- function(   input_points,   point_id_field = NULL,   resolution = NULL,   generalize = FALSE,   token = arc_token() ) {    # create a list of parameters   params <- compact(list(     InputPoints = as_esri_featureset(input_points),     PointIdField = point_id_field,     DataSourceResolution = resolution,     Generalize = as.character(generalize),     f = "json"   ))    service_url <- "https://hydro.arcgis.com/arcgis/rest/services/Tools/Hydrology/GPServer/TraceDownstream"   arc_gp_job$new(     base_url = service_url,     params = params,     result_fn = parse_gp_feature_record_set,     token   ) } # create input points input_points <- st_sfc(   st_point(c(-159.548936, 21.955888)),   crs = 4326 )  # initialze an empty job job <- trace_downstream(   input_points,   token = auth_user() )  # start the job job$start() #> <arc_gp_job> #> Job ID: jd9f76de1e62e4d8a877f3e6859fdb7b2 #> Status: not started #> Resource: /TraceDownstream #> Params: #> • InputPoints #> • Generalize #> • f job$status #> <arcgisutils::arc_job_status> #>  @ status: chr "esriJobSubmitted" job$results #> $param_name #> [1] "OutputTraceLine" #>  #> $data_type #> [1] "GPFeatureRecordSetLayer" #>  #> $geometry #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 6 fields #> Geometry type: MULTILINESTRING #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 438895 ymin: 2422310 xmax: 443325 ymax: 2428045 #> Projected CRS: NAD83 / UTM zone 4N + Unknown VCS #>   OBJECTID PourPtID               Description DataResolution LengthKm #> 1        1        1 NED 10m processed by Esri           10.0 9.489823 #>   Shape_Length                       geometry #> 1     9489.823 MULTILINESTRING ((443325 24...  # store and view the results res <- job$results res #> $param_name #> [1] "OutputTraceLine" #>  #> $data_type #> [1] "GPFeatureRecordSetLayer" #>  #> $geometry #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 6 fields #> Geometry type: MULTILINESTRING #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 438895 ymin: 2422310 xmax: 443325 ymax: 2428045 #> Projected CRS: NAD83 / UTM zone 4N + Unknown VCS #>   OBJECTID PourPtID               Description DataResolution LengthKm #> 1        1        1 NED 10m processed by Esri           10.0 9.489823 #>   Shape_Length                       geometry #> 1     9489.823 MULTILINESTRING ((443325 24...  # plot the resultant geometry plot(st_geometry(res$geometry))

title: Set user-agent for arcgisutils — arc_agent
text: Override default user-agent set httr2 indicate request came arcgisutils.

title: Set user-agent for arcgisutils — arc_agent
code: arc_agent(req)

title: Set user-agent for arcgisutils — arc_agent
text: req httr2 request

title: Set user-agent for arcgisutils — arc_agent
text: httr2 request object

title: Set user-agent for arcgisutils — arc_agent
code: req <- httr2::request("http://example.com") arc_agent(req) #> <httr2_request> #> GET http://example.com #> Body: empty #> Options: #> * useragent: "arcgisutils v0.3.3.9000"

title: Generate base request — arc_base_req
text: function takes url creates basic httr2 request adds user-agent adds authorization token X-Esri-Authorization header.

title: Generate base request — arc_base_req
code: arc_base_req(   url,   token = NULL,   path = NULL,   query = NULL,   error_call = rlang::caller_env() )

title: Generate base request — arc_base_req
text: url valid url passed httr2::request() token object class httr2_token generated auth_code() related function path character vector paths appended url using httr2::req_url_path_append() query named vector named list query parameters appended url using httr2::req_url_query() error_call caller environment used propagating errors.

title: Generate base request — arc_base_req
text: httr2_request X-Esri-Authorization header User-Agent set.

title: Generate base request — arc_base_req
code: arc_base_req("https://arcgis.com") #> <httr2_request> #> GET https://arcgis.com #> Body: empty #> Options: #> * useragent: "arcgisutils v0.3.3.9000"

title: Form request parameters — arc_form_params
text: ArcGIS endpoints make extensive use form encoded data body http requests. Form requests require element name encoded single string—often json.

title: Form request parameters — arc_form_params
code: arc_form_params(params = list())  as_form_params(x)

title: Form request parameters — arc_form_params
text: params named list scalar character elements x as_form_params(), named list convert form parameters

title: Form request parameters — arc_form_params
text: object class arc_form_params

title: Form request parameters — arc_form_params
text: arc_form_params class provides validation form body parameters ensuring element scalar string. uses named list internally store parameters. helper function as_form_params() converts named list form parameters automatically JSON-encoding element using yyjsonr::write_json_str() auto_unbox = TRUE.

title: Form request parameters — arc_form_params
code: arc_form_params(   list(f = "json", outFields = "*", where = "1 = 1") ) #> <arcgisutils::arc_form_params> #>  @ params:List of 3 #>  .. $ f        : chr "json" #>  .. $ outFields: chr "*" #>  .. $ where    : chr "1 = 1"

title: Fetch Group Information — arc_group
text: Fetches metadata group based provided group_id.

title: Fetch Group Information — arc_group
code: arc_group(group_id, host = arc_host(), token = arc_token())

title: Fetch Group Information — arc_group
text: group_id unique group identifier. scalar character. host default "https://www.arcgis.com". host ArcGIS Portal. token httr2_token created auth_code() similar

title: Fetch Group Information — arc_group
text: list group metadata

title: Fetch Group Information — arc_group
code: arc_group("2f0ec8cb03574128bd673cefab106f39") #> <PortalGroup<Web Application Templates>> #> id: 2f0ec8cb03574128bd673cefab106f39 #> owner: esri_en #> created: 2012-02-10 00:27:49

title: Geoprocessing Job Status — arc_job_status

title: Geoprocessing Job Status — arc_job_status
text: status scalar character. Must one "esriJobSubmitted", "esriJobWaiting", "esriJobExecuting", "esriJobSucceeded", "esriJobFailed", "esriJobTimedOut", "esriJobCancelling", "esriJobCancelled".

title: Paginate ArcGIS Requests — arc_paginate_req

title: Authorization — auth_code
text: Authorize R session connect ArcGIS Portal. See details.

title: Authorization — auth_code
code: auth_code(client = Sys.getenv("ARCGIS_CLIENT"), host = arc_host())  auth_client(   client = Sys.getenv("ARCGIS_CLIENT"),   secret = Sys.getenv("ARCGIS_SECRET"),   host = arc_host(),   expiration = 120 )  auth_binding()  auth_user(   username = Sys.getenv("ARCGIS_USER"),   password = Sys.getenv("ARCGIS_PASSWORD"),   host = arc_host(),   expiration = 60 )  auth_key(api_key = Sys.getenv("ARCGIS_API_KEY"), host = arc_host())  refresh_token(token, client = Sys.getenv("ARCGIS_CLIENT"), host = arc_host())  validate_or_refresh_token(   token,   client = Sys.getenv("ARCGIS_CLIENT"),   host = arc_host(),   refresh_threshold = 10,   call = rlang::caller_env() )

title: Authorization — auth_code
text: client OAuth 2.0 developer application client ID. default uses environment variable ARCGIS_CLIENT. host default "https://www.arcgis.com". host ArcGIS Portal. secret OAuth 2.0 developer application secret. default uses environment variable ARCGIS_SECRET. expiration duration token minutes. username default Sys.getenv("ARCGIS_USER"). username login. hard code value. password default Sys.getenv("ARCGIS_PASSWORD"). password login. hard code value. api_key default Sys.getenv("ARCGIS_API_KEY"). character scalar ArcGIS Developer API key. token httr2_token created auth_code() similar refresh_threshold default 10. token expiry within threshold (seconds) token refreshed refresh_token available. Token refreshing possible auth_code() flow. call execution environment currently running function, e.g. call = caller_env(). corresponding function call retrieved mentioned error messages source error. need supply call throwing condition helper function relevant mention message. Can also NULL defused function call respectively display call hard-code code display. information error calls, see Including function calls error messages.

title: Authorization — auth_code
text: httr2_token

title: Authorization — auth_code
text: ArcGIS Online Enterprise Portals utilize OAuth2 authorization via REST APIs. auth_code() recommend OAuth2 workflow interactive sessions auth_client() recommended OAuth2 workflow non-interactive sessions auth_user() uses legacy username password authorization using generateToken endpoint. recommended legacy systems implement OAuth2. auth_binding() fetches token active portal set arcgisbinding. Uses arcgisbinding::arc.check_portal() extract authorization token. Recommended using arcgisbinding.

title: Geoprocessing Parameter Types — gp_params
text: package provides support following geoprocessing parameter types:

title: Geoprocessing Parameter Types — gp_params
text: GPFeatureRecordSetLayer: Feature collections geometry attributes GPRecordSet: Tabular data without geometry GPRasterDataLayer: Raster datasets Portal items, Image Servers, URLs GPLinearUnit: Linear distance measurements units GPArealUnit: Area measurements units GPDate: Date/time values milliseconds since epoch GPSpatialReference: Coordinate reference systems

title: Geoprocessing Parameter Types — gp_params
text: following types planned future implementation: GPField: Field definitions name, type, properties GPMultiValue: Arrays values single data type GPValueTable: Flexible table-like objects rows columns GPComposite: Parameters accept multiple data types GPEnvelope: Bounding box extents (use as_extent() GPExtent)

title: Geoprocessing Parameter Types — gp_params
text: functions follow consistent pattern: as_gp_*(): Convert R objects geoprocessing parameter JSON parse_gp_*(): Parse geoprocessing response JSON R objects Constructor functions (e.g., gp_linear_unit(), gp_areal_unit()) create typed S7 objects

title: Create Esri layer objects — as_layer
text: x object class data.frame. can sf object tibble subclass data.frame. name scalar character name layer. Must unique. title user-friendly string title layer can used table contents. layer_definition layer definition list created as_layer_definition(). default derived x name object. id number indicating index position layer WMS map service. layer_url default NULL. string URL service used queries layer. Used hosted tiled map services ArcGIS Online associated feature service allows queries. legend_url default NULL. string URL legend graphic layer. Used WMS layers. URL usually contains GetLegendGraphic request. popup_info default NULL. list can converted popupInfo object defining pop-window content layer. helper popupInfo objects. call execution environment currently running function, e.g. call = caller_env(). corresponding function call retrieved mentioned error messages source error. need supply call throwing condition helper function relevant mention message. Can also NULL defused function call respectively display call hard-code code display. information error calls, see Including function calls error messages. object_id_field scalar character vector indicating name object ID field dataset. fields data.frame describing fields x. values inferred default via infer_esri_type(). display_field default NULL. scalar character containing name field best summarizes feature. Values field used default titles pop-windows. drawing_info default NULL. See REST documentation details . helpers validators drawingInfo objects. has_attachments default FALSE. max_scale default NULL. number representing maximum scale layer definition applied. number scale's denominator; thus, value 2400 represents scale 1/2,400. value 0 indicates layer definition applied regardless far zoom . min_scale default NULL. number representing minimum scale layer definition applied. templates default NULL. See REST documentation details . type_id_field default NULL. See REST documentation details . types array type objects available dataset. used type_id_field populated. NOTE helper functions create type objects. type list objects must match json structure passed jsonify::to_json(x, unbox = TRUE). layers list layers created as_layer(). show_legend default FALSE. Logical scalar indicating layer shown legend client applications.

title: Search for Portal Items — search_items
code: search_items(   query = NULL,   filter = NULL,   title = NULL,   description = NULL,   snippet = NULL,   tags = NULL,   owner = NULL,   orgid = NULL,   item_type = NULL,   type_keywords = NULL,   created = NULL,   modified = NULL,   categories = NULL,   category_filters = NULL,   sort_field = NULL,   sort_order = NULL,   count_fields = NULL,   count_size = NULL,   display_sublayers = FALSE,   filter_logic = "and",   bbox = NULL,   page_size = 50,   max_pages = Inf,   .progress = TRUE,   host = arc_host(),   token = arc_token() )

title: Search for Portal Items — search_items
text: query scalar character free text search valid query string defined REST API. filter scalar character. provided arguments except query ignored. title optional character vector content item titles. description, snippet optional scalar character text check . tags optional character vector tags search . owner optional character vector owner usernames search . orgid optional character vector organization IDs search . item_type optional character vector content item types. Validated item_type(). type_keywords optional character vector content tpye keywords. Validated item_keyword(). created, modified optional length two vector must coercible date time vector. Converted using .POSIXct(). Returns items within range. categories optional character vector 8 organization content categories. category_filters optional character vector 3 category terms. Items matching categories returned. Exclusive categories. sort_field optional character vector fields sort . Can sort title, created, type, owner, modified, avgrating, numratings, numcomments, numviews, scorecompleteness. sort_order optional string. One either asc desc ascending descending order respectively. count_fields optional character vector 3 fields count. Must one c("type", "access", "contentstatus", "categories"). count_size optional integer determines maximum number field values count counted field count_fields. Maximum 200. display_sublayers default FALSE. Returns feature layers inside feature services. filter_logic default "" must one c("", "", ""). Determines parameters bbox unimplemented. page_size scalar integer 1 100 indicating number responses per page. max_pages maximum number pages fetch. default fetches pages. .progress default TRUE. Whether display progress bar requests. host default "https://www.arcgis.com". host ArcGIS Portal. token object class httr2_token generated auth_code() related function

title: Manage authorization tokens — arc_token
text: possible multiple authorization tokens one session. functions assist managing . arc_token() used fetch tokens name. default token ARCGIS_TOKEN. However, can valid character scalar. set_arc_token() create store token name ARCGIS_TOKEN. However, can alternatively set tokens name using key-value pair. key pass arc_token() fetch httr2_token object. remove token set, use unset_arc_token(). obj_check_token() developer oriented function can used check object indeed httr2_token. check token expired, validate_or_refresh_token() . check_token_has_user() developer oriented function checks see token username field associated . developers: set_arc_token() uses package level environment store tokens. tokens fetched environment using arc_token().

title: Manage authorization tokens — arc_token
code: # create fake tokens token_a <- httr2::oauth_token("1234", arcgis_host = arc_host()) token_b <- httr2::oauth_token("abcd", arcgis_host = arc_host())  # set token to the default location set_arc_token(token_a)  # fetch token from the default location arc_token() #> <httr2_token> #> * token_type  : "bearer" #> * access_token: <REDACTED> #> * arcgis_host : "https://www.arcgis.com"  # set token by name set_arc_token(org_a = token_a, org_b = token_b) #> ✔ Named tokens set: `org_a` and `org_b` #> ℹ Access named tokens with `arc_token("name")`  # fetch token by name arc_token("org_a") #> <httr2_token> #> * token_type  : "bearer" #> * access_token: <REDACTED> #> * arcgis_host : "https://www.arcgis.com" arc_token("org_b") #> <httr2_token> #> * token_type  : "bearer" #> * access_token: <REDACTED> #> * arcgis_host : "https://www.arcgis.com"  # unset tokens unset_arc_token() #> ✔ Token `ARCGIS_TOKEN` has been unset. unset_arc_token(c("org_a", "org_b")) #> ✔ Tokens `org_a` and `org_b` have been unset.

title: arcgisutils (development version)
text: Adds arc_portal_servers() list federated servers ArcGIS Enterprise portal Adds arc_portal_resources() list file resources given portal ID Adds arc_portal_users() list users provided portal Adds search_item() search content items automatic pagination. Adds arc_user_self() return metadata authenticated user Adds arc_group_content() arc_user_content() fetch user group content listings Adds arc_paginate_req() automatically apply pagination requests Adds support parsing creating geoprocessing service json see ?gp_params arc_gp_job, arc_job_status, arc_form_params Adds S7 R6 dependencies Adds data_frame() utility function adds tbl class data.frame pretty tibble printing without requiring tibble dependency. Adds new experimental functions parsing urls arc_url_parse(), arc_url_type(), is_url() h/t @elipousson Adds new experimental functions working portal’s sharing API arc_item(), arc_group(), arc_user(), arc_item_data(), arc_portal_urls() Validate token arc_base_req()

text: CRAN release: 2024-09-26 addresses bug integers encoded floats. caused problem using update_features() specifying OID field

title: arcgisutils 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-05-09 arcgisutils now requires Rust build source jsonify moved Suggests as_geometry() longer exported ... argument removed auth_key() added support authorization API key ArcGIS Developers accounts catch_error() new function parses string catches error object. useful processing multiple responses . rbind_results() new helper function combines list results efficiently possible. arc_base_req() gains two new arguments path query allows add query parameters paths generated base request arc_self_meta() new function provide access /self endpoint. Closes #32 Null geometries parsed empty Geometry Collections using sf::st_geometrycollection() Fixed #168 Esri JSON contains 0 features, parse_esri_json() create empty data.frame fields returned appropriate R type.

title: arcgisutils 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-02-22 parse_esri_json() return empty data.frame presence empty results error. error present, error reported Tokens now stored internal environment token_env set_auth_token() removed favor set_arc_token() set_arc_token() allows multiple named keys set token_env arc_token() fetches tokens directly token_env unset_arc_token() removes tokens token_env intended used arc_base_req() https://github.com/R-ArcGIS/arcgisutils/pull/19 httr2 must >= 1.0.0 now New function arc_agent() added set package specific user agent accepts NULL tokens uses req_auth_bearer_token() include token header https://github.com/R-ArcGIS/arcgisutils/pull/8 Define arc_token() get “ARCGIS_TOKEN” environment variable. ensures empty strings cause HTTP 498 “invalid token” error returning NULL stead empty string. (#6) @kbvernon
